intro: Eunomia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf eunomia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are rounded and have a distinctive lobed appearance. It produces showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. Eunomia rotundifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
